fields.description:
Expands the grammar, starting from the given symbol.
 
RiGrammar.expand() is equivalent to RiGrammar.expandFrom('<start>').

parameters.desc: the rule from which to start the expansion
the object on which to call any (back-ticked) callback functions (optional)

fields.description:
Expands the grammar after replacing an instance of the non-terminal 'symbol' with the String in 'literal'.
 
Guarantees that 'literal' will be in the final expanded String, assuming at least one instance of 'symbol' in the Grammar.

parameters.desc: the object on which to call any (back-ticked) callback functions (optional)

fields.description: Re-initializes the grammar from a file or URL containing the grammar rules

parameters.desc: File or URL containing the grammar rules

If a Function is supplied (in JavaScript), it will be called after the file is loaded.
If a PApplet(in Java) is passed, it will be used to locate and check the 'data' folder of the sketch for the specified file

fields.platform: Delegates to RiTa.loadString() to load. To check if the object has finished loading, check RiGrammar.ready(). Alternatively, one can use the <script src=...> tag to include the JSON grammar file in an html page (probably a better option).
